intro: Turritis rigidula, commonly known as the rigid turritis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it blooms during the summer months. Turritis rigidula is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
